review: Honestly I have grown more and more displeased with TGI Friday's in general. Their prices keep rising and their portion sizes keep shrinking. But usually the food is quite good. At this particular TGI Friday's, however.... the food is not even up to the standards I have come to know at TGI Friday's.... and the service isn't that good either. The Chili's a few dozen yards away, however.... is quite good and I would recommend that.
I am ALWAYS happy to eat here,and you have to have the Dragonfire chicken,it really is the Truth. Love the drinks and the fact that they always have a special going on.This is my place to hang.

Well... it's a TGIFs. Pretty much exactly what you would expect from such a place.  Came in on at 7.30pm on a Wednesday and waited 5-7 minutes for the host to show up. I do not know where he was or what he was doing, but it is kind of awkward standing there that long contemplating if you should leave and walk over to the Buffalo Wild Wings for better service. This was the low point of the meal. Waiter was extremely friendly and this mentality appears to carry on through the staff here. We had the queso with beef dip and chips for appetizer which was pretty good. I myself had boneless wings with the Carribean bourbon sauce for a meal and the fiancee had a small steak with mashed potatoes and parmesan fries. The fries were for me and was delicious. She enjoyed her meal also. If you have ever been to a TGIFs before than you know what to expect. Like any other quality chain elements of the chain have strong similarities regardless of where you are in the world. The awkward wait initially by the host knocked the score down a star but the extremely good service nullified this lost. You like TGIF then you will still like it after coming to this location.

I personally happen to like TGIF no matter where I go. I usually tend to try to stay away from the bar on this one, only because of how loud it is. If you sit on the other side of the restaurant it tends to get a little more quieter and you can actually hear the other person you're with. The service has never been anything shy of good. My waiters/waitresses are always very attentive and check on us at least a couple times to make sure everything is great. The only thing I will say about this location is I absolutely love the green bean fries TGIF's offers, but the last 3 times I've gotten them from this particular restaurant, I've gotten sick. And it's ONLY that one item because after I get sick, I'm fine. it's the weirdest thing. Other than that, food is always great and tasty. I don't really have many complaints about this chain :)

When I was college age, the TGI Fridays used to be THE spot for drinks, food or to work. It was a hotspot for the young crowd.  Somewhere down the line they changed. no more red & white stripes with flare, no more young vibrant atmosphere. Now it's the equivalent of an AppleBees.  "Meh". The food is decent but nothing "wow" about it. It's where people on a budget go out for a "fancy dinner", NOT a place for foodies or the like. It might as well be in an airport terminal. I miss the TGI Fridays circa 1990. Now it's just 1 step above fast food.
Brittany, the worst waitress ever! I've been there a few times and it definitely turned me off to this location. Never again

Not good at all....waitress walks away before we're done talking. My BBQ chicken flatbread has no BBQ sauce on it and the plate has a guacamole fingerprint and I don't have guacamole. My husband got ahi tuna crisps and his guacamole is FROZEN! They replaced it, and it's STILL FROZEN! The pasta dish my friend has is cold and my husbands fiery burger is not "fiery" at all, and he was told it had to be well done...why?  We will not be returning, and I used to like this place. Sad.

Stay away from the crush drinks - like cherry-lime. They are 3/4's ice. 4 sips & done. I complained 2 the waitress & she says "oh they're supposed 2 be that way". "Refill?" I ask. "Oh no that'll cost extra"!

I personally love this location of TGI Fridays. I've been to others, such as the one on Berlin Turnpike and the service was terrible. The service here I find amazing, and being a vegatarian, the black bean burger is one of my favorites. Also, their bruschetta and craft beer pretzel dip is a MUST have at any Fridays. The best on the menu. I go to this location about twice a month and definitely don't plan on stopping anytime soon.
Our server was great, and the food was on par with other chain restaurants, but the entire restaurant felt like it was covered in grease.

Really came a long way. When it first opened, I thought it was expensive and the food wasn't great. Since then I have enjoyed their drinks and food. Nachos are great there and the chicken is worth a look, but not the price. The place is clean considering where it is, but it still has that grungy waterbury feel on the inside. Especially the bathrooms. Parking lot is horrible. Can never get a spot without parking across the lot. Staff is very friendly and concerned about their customers. For example, the bartender poured a guy a drink, noticed it had not been cleaned thoroughly and re-poured him that very same drink in another glass (foam everywhere in dirty glass). If you are looking for some late night fun, TGI Friday's is a nice choice, but there are better alternatives.

I have visited TGIF'S in Waterbury several times and had to wait for a hostess, walk on sticky floors,  (not just around the smelly bar but throughout the restaurant) sit in ripped up booths, get served drinks out of dirty glassware. NO MAS.

I really find this Fridays to be frustrating. From cold food to inattentive waitstaff to a merely mediocre dining experience at best; this Fridays lacks it all. The only thing that geta me to come back on occasion (formerly weekly but now maybe once per month) is Tuesday Trivia.

I can start out by saying that in a nutshell, this place is alright. I'm not a fan of the decor, but that won't effect my dining experience. The food here no matter what you get, probably won't be five star worthy, but it ain't bad. If buffalo wild wings is packed, come here.

Wow, was that really a Fridays? Arrived about 10pm, hostess advised they'd clear a table for us! Kind of a surprise that late in the evening that they're not keeping up on the housekeeping. Meet our waiter Brad, very friendly, very attentive and responsive. Food comes, all appy's for our late evening snack and even my teen age son eventually utters the phrase "underwhelmed" as he pokes one serving around the plate with his finger. This is a guy that will eat raw poptarts and pbj's if left to his own devices. Potato skins, always a great standby,...these looked very familiar. Definitely not the large half skins with fresh cheese and bacon melted inside that you normally see at TGIF's, what we got were the thin quarter potato pieces, with blobby off color, putty textured cheese. I swear, they're TGIF skins from the grocery store. While they're hot, they look like they just slid out of the box from the freezer. BBQ chicken flatbread. Did I miss something? Is the chicken BBQ'd? No BBQ sauce on the flatbread, just a glaze of multicolored cheeses. Again, everything looks dull and oddly textured, like it was frozen a half hour earlier.  Finally Sesame Jack Chicken Strips. First off, we get chicken pieces, nugget shaped/sized chunks rather than anything of length that would resemble a "strip", but at least it was whole chicken. Overcooked into crunchy flavorless challenges. We choked these down, total fail, but it's late and we wanted out of there.  TGI's is not cheap, the food has to measure up. This experience pushes the chain as a whole down a peg or two as we work our way through shopping districts with multi choices. Was the wait staff doing the cooking and following the directions from grocery store packaging? This should never happen, 0-3 on appetizers. It's nearly criminal.  A quick walk to the uninspired mens room, found the back half of the restaurant with slipperly, greasy floors, like a KFC.....We were deadlocked on BWW vs TGIF as we entered the parking lot. I broke the tie and headed to Fridays because we're usually pretty happy with the contents of the long plates. That changed tonight!

My rating is based on the latest experience. I don't normally come to a Fridays at all.  Just wanted to switch it up. 9PM on a Sunday, I can understand the slow service. It was freezing cold in the bar area. Within ten minutes my food was an ice bucket.  It's a Sunday during football season and NONE of the TVs in the bar were set to the game. Until my fiancé asked to change the program that was already on three other TVs.  Other than that the flavor of the jack Daniels glaze is the only thing keeping me from never coming again.

Been to many tgif's and this is by far the worst.  Drinks took 15 min. Food was under cooked and cold bread was stale.  Would never recommend this place to anyone.   Please go across to chilies or Buffalo Wild Wings

By far the least satrlisfying experiences I've had in CT. Taking advantage of the "endless apps" promotion, thinking it would be a satisfying and quick meal turned out to be just the opposite. We watched customers order entrees and be served after our order had been taken. There was little communication about the delay on our order and when it finally did arrive it was cold. Beverage service also was slow.  Definitely not worth the time and effort.

I've Never Have Been So Pissed Off IN My life! An hour into this place and still haven't placed my order for my entrée. . I was so pissed off I felt like I had to get up and train him how to do his job. I than asked him can I make my order and he gets pissed . Then to make things worse It took 30 mins to get my drink! All I have to say Is this place is the shitiest place I've ever been to and the staff needs to be trained properly.  Where the f*** did they find these ppl?

We have tried this place a few times over the past year or so and last night really made our minds up on it. Really don't bother unless you want to sit at the bar. The restaurant is just not well attended too. We were shown to our table very promptly, but all the surrounding tables were still cluttered with previous meals left overs etc. Which stayed that way all through our visit.  Our server took ages to come and talk to us and take a drinks order, she was friendly enough, but then she went directly to the front area and spent a good 10 minutes or so chatting with a friend there before putting in our orders. I think the staff try, but its just a reflection of the management or the area that brings this place down. The food is actually not that great, good for a meal to keep you going, but not worth driving to for an occasion etc. Best advice is to go to Chili's across the parking lot. Atmosphere is better, staff are more lively, foods better. It will be a long long time till we return here, if at all. - it probably deserves to close down and be replaced something better.

Hostess took us to a table in the dirtiest part of the Restraurant. This should have been the signal for us to leave. Cold hamburger and fries. Wife could not eat her dinner. Save your money and go elsewhere.

Absolutely awesome meal. Did the 10$ unlimited appetizers for lunch and they were all amazing. Heather was my bartender, she was very attentive, always took care of me and made conversation while she was running around. Great service!

Fridays. What can I say. Usually food is pretty good. Drinks are beyond terrible. I mean lock jaw from margarita mix terrible! Just nasty!  I went here last night with my sister. We ordered an apple martini and boneless hot wing app. The wings came before the drinks. 10 minutes later our apple martinis came. First off let me just say I knew their drinks were always disgusting , but in my mind how can u f&@$ up a dam martini? But yea they f@&$ed it up. Lol smh. It wasn't even green? Is this a yellow apple martini? And who puts ice in a martini? wtf ?Whatever, it was happy hour so I just let it slide blaming myself for even bothering.  We both ordered grilled salmon with lobster sauce and mash. Delicious! We ordered another hot wing app to take home. The waitress convinced us to just order the all u can eat apps for 10 bucks seeing it would be the same price. Was ready to go didn't really want too but we did anyway. The wings we first ordered were actually really good. The wings they brought out the second time were disgusting! Old burnt oil taste. What happened? Yall burnt the oil that fast since the first round? No thank you. My sister says the all you can eat apps are the reject wings from other orders lol. She might just be right!  Don't order drinks unless you LOVE margarita mix!!! I've been coming here for years trust me drinks are not their thing...too bad so sad!

Stopped here after a three-hour trip on a Sunday night around 8:00.  Hardly anyone there and got seated promptly. Quite a wait for the waitress to come.  My mom ordered cream of broccoli soup that was not even warm and had a huge stalk in it. My trio of appetizers were not warm either.  When the waitress came over to check on us, I told her my food wasn't warm and she whipped my plate away to the kitchen.  When she came back, she had a female manager with her.  I pointed out the problem with the huge stalk in my mom's cold soup and my food not even being warm.  The manager said sorry, offered to give us a new order, but I told her no thanks, we're just going to leave, explaining that we just travelled for 3 hours.  She then offered to wrap the food for us.  I told her no thanks, we're just going to leave.  In a very snotty voice, she said well, I was going to give it to you for free anyway!  Not going back there any time soon!
Drinks were sent back too watery. Waitress & Waiters Take there time attending  to the customer.  Horrible Service

The server Nicolle is bad! 3 appetizers up, Only 2 set of fork on the table (it's on the table before we be seated) No plates at all. Okay, we asks for plates (she THROW it to the table) however 3 plates are DIRTY ... It seems like some tomato and pepper pieces. We ask her to replace it and she gives us ATTITUDE. It make it look like we are annoying customers. We pay for clean food, Not for the dirty plates that may cause is sick! We pay for service, not for people who rude to us!  By the way... Foods are bad!  The steak tasty ugly without sauces,  the baby rips taste like nothing... It feel like they put it into microwave make it hot then put BBQ sauce on top... That's it.  6 people (4 adults and 2 kids) no one like the food! We ended up buy Mc Donald next door!!

It's kind of hard to review a chain because once you've been to one location you've been to them all more or less. I'd recommend sitting at the bar here because the service there is much better. The drinks are weak as hell but they have a lot of great specials throughout the week so I don't mind. Any meal here that comes with their jack daniels sauce is amazing. Everything else is hit or miss. This is a solid option though in waterbury if you're looking for a casual inexpensive meal. It's definitely better than the chilies or buffalo wild wings in this same plaza.
The place sucks!!! I know it's a chain restaurant but the food is dry and straight out the   yourself a favor and go across the parking lot and hit up chilies if your looking for that kind of food.

The wait was 10 mins only because I called ahead. Now we've been here almost 2hrs and we are still waiting for our  refill of endless apps. The first order took 40 min. The wait here is totally uncalled for. The waitress was excellent but who knows what's going on in the kitchen. Got here at 635p and it's now 8:30p and we are still waiting. Never again! When my food gets here I want it wrapped so I can leave. Save yourself a trip and go somewhere else Endless apps,more like endless waiting!!!!!

Food was okay, exactly what you would expect. However, it took FOREVER to get our food. Don't do the endless apps!!! It took us 45 minutes to get our first appetizer and then 20-30 minutes for every one after that! Good thing we weren't in a rush!

My family and I went here for Easter Sunday. The food was delicious and the service was excellent. We had a server named Kaitltin. She was very nice, had a good professional personality, and she was always on the ball when it came to getting our food and drinks. She was very knowledge of the restaurant for only being there for one month. We actually thought that she had been there for awhile! We didn't have any problems waiting for the endless apps like other people did. She is one of the best servers there! Even when she was working hard she still had the time to have a conversation with us. She made us feel happy and comfortable! We definitely recommend Kaitltin and the restaurant! Keep up the good work!

Our waitress was wonderful, the food was good, not exceptional but hey it's as expected. This Waterbury location a bit grimy but if you're from the Waterbury area you're used to it. Overall I would visit again and recommend for an easy night out, took my brother here today we got two drinks, spinach dip appetizer, and two entrees, total with tip was under $50. And they are now offering a rewards program for frequent guests!

I don't typically write reviews unless I have really great or really bad service and today was horrible. We went in between lunch and dinner time so there was no excuse for us to have the service we did. We had a toddler with us and requested a booster seat from 4 different staff and didn't get it until we were almost done with our meal. The host staff were rude and rolled their eyes when we told them we couldn't sit at a high top table with a 3 yr old. Our food was cold. Our waitress didn't come back to check on us once during the meal, only to take our order and deliver the check. Guests at the table next to us were complaining about the lack of attention from waitstaff as well. I will never go back to this place and wouldn't recommend it to anyone.

Ok so normally in restaurants you do not need to be seated in a bar area but this location apparently you do... I found this out after sitting for 10min without being acknowledged.  So there was a wait for the bar area completely empty restaurant but would not honor the bar specials in restaurant area ok so we wait ...... Wait 20 min to get into the bar wait 10 min for a martini and go to order to find out they are out of steak! What chain restaurant runs out of steak at 6pm dinner time on a Monday. Requested the check for my one martini that in total waited almost an hour for and took my business to chilis right in the same lot.  Got seated served and left in the amount of time I waited for my 1 martini at Friday's

I always love coming to TGI Fridays! The food is delicious and the service is excellent! I had a server named Kaitlin. She was very nice, had a good professional personality, and she always was on the ball when it came to getting my food and drink. She was very knowledgeable of the restaurant by knowing a lot about the menu! I think that she is one of the best servers there! Even when she was working hard she still had the time to have conversations with her customers! She makes everyone feel happy and comfortable! I definitely recommend Kaitlin and this restaurant! Keep up the good work!

The Jack Daniel ribs are delicious! Although their getting smaller I luv the taste ! They also have Parmesan macaroni and cheese which normally is so good I have to get two sides today it was disgusting. They cook the macaroni throw it in the bowl a few drops of cheese in the middle and didn't bother to stir it, But still serve us that crap. We sent it back and whoever was working in the kitchen obviously didn't care! I didnt even bother with what came back!

James and Kameron are hands down the best bartenders in that building... went out to eat and not always pleased with this place. But it was a Monday night when i went in to eat at the bar... the cousins gave me a very warm welcome as i sat down and kept the cocktails acoming. food was great and customer service was spot on!

Staff very attentive and fast, never had to wonder where my food was at. Wish I could eat there everyday. I'm usually there between noon and 7p. To be fair, it's not too crowded at these times. Foods good, particularly the burgers. Stephanie the bartender is great....very friendly and attentive.

DIRTY!  I stopped in for dinner and a couple of drinks last night with the boyfriend and walked around the bar area and had to head to the opposite side because the bar top was dirty. Then both my fork and knife were disgustingly coated with food remnants.  We first order the blackberry margarita, it was sour and not that good.  My bf next ordered a beer and without even asking the size, he was brought a tall beer, because they were out of short glasses.  I then ordered a fresh strawberry mule.  This drink also failed to impress me, it was just sour, and not tasty.  For an entrée I ordered the beef stroganoff.  It had good flavor, but it was cold and there were mostly purple onions and barely any meat at all in the dish.  My bf ordered the truffle burger but forgot to ask for it to be cooked medium and was not asked how he wanted it cook and it came out well done and he did not enjoy this burger at all.   Friday's used to be a "go to" chain for us for decent drinks and appetizers, we are definitely going to rethink this the next time we go out.  The bartender was friendly& efficient enough for a 20% tip.

Ate here today. I've eaten here about three times before this,  and this time they gave me rotten coleslaw.  The smell of it made me want to puke.  I love coleslaw but it was just disgusting.  The other stuff was good, and I asked the waitress to throw out the rest of it so that other people wouldn't get it.  Then the manager came and said it tasted fine, but gave me a coupon.  A lot of people don't like coleslaw, which is why I'm betting it was rotten, nobody eats it.  It's a nice place but for your own sake, do NOT eat the coleslaw. It's disgusting and it has probably been there for long after anything should be consumed.
TGIFriday's is an affordable restaurant with lots of good food.  The ambience is nice.  The staff is friendly.  Plenty of parking.  I've got Friday's on my mind.  Let's go.

Went there recently and just didn't have a good experience from start to finish.  My girlfriend and I sat at the bar and the bartender was very nice and patient with us, but the positives end there. We ordered some beer which had a skunky flavor to them, so we sent them back and requested to sample other beers so we could find something we liked.  We tried 2-3 IPAs and they were both watered down and had zero flavor.  We then decided to get bottled beer and even that was bad, another watered down IPA followed by a Coors Light which we decided to tolerate even though it too had no flavor.  During this time the manager on duty came out and gave us some obviously BS excuses as to why 6 different beers were either watered down or tasted like garbage. We ordered food as well which took forever to come out. It was okay, not really worth the price of going out.   I hate to bash them because our server was being very patient with us and we could tell he was really trying, but there is no way in hell that many problems could occur in one restaurant without some type of negligence toward food/beverage quality.

I was here for lunch on Tuesday and had a good experience.  The place was pretty empty but the music playing was quite loud.  We asked the waitress if she could lower it a bit and she did.  I ordered the Jack Daniels chicken with jasmine rice and broccoli.  They have a dinner sized portion that comes with two chicken breasts and a smaller portion with just one.  I ordered the lunch sized entree and it was perfect.  It was inexpensive and I had no complaints about anything.  I live close to the Manchester TGI Fridays and hadn't been in a very long time.   I was meeting my aunt who lives in NY so we met in Waterbury.  I think I'll check out the Manchester branch again soon since it's closer.  I really loved the food.

So how do you offer endless apps and have nothing but a few of the items to offer. How do you run a business and run out of food? Seriously? And when you do order a second round of apps, the serving is reduced. One of the apps was the meatballs, first of which we received 4, then on the second round we received 3. The boneless buffalo wings were dry and the chicken flatbread, which was actually very good, they ran out of after the first serving. On top of that, it took forever to get to our main course and even longer for the waitress to take our money. This restaurant has definitely gone down hill. Don't waste your money

My wife and I went for supper today and when I unwrapped the eating utensils found a knife and fork with dried food on them.  Needless to say I was disgusted and asked to speak to a manager.  A waiter came to our table, asked if there was an issue, and I explained, and showed him, the dirty utensils.  He said he would get a manager and started to collect the dirty utensils. I started to stop him and said I want the manager to see what I was complaining about.  He assured me he would make sure the manager would see the dirty utensils.  A few moments later the manager stopped by our table and asked if there was an issue.   I said yes there is and asked if he saw the dirty utensils.  He replied he did not.  Fortunately I had taken a picture of the knife and fork and showed the manager.  He apologized but didn't seem very surprised and after hearing me out left our table.

Went here a couple weeks ago with my friend. The menu was so ridiculous. The advertisement was so falsely advertised. The food is decent, but the service and advertisements really pissed us off. We vowed never to go again.

If I could give 0 stars I would! This place is ridiculous! I went there today for an early birthday dinner.  It took 20 mins for the waitress to come over to take our drink orders. When our drinks finally get there, she gives my 16 year old my Sex on the Beach and tells me that my drink (Sex on the Beach)is still being made After a good 10 mins then she comes back and says that the drinks are mixed up. She then took 20 mins to actually bring us our food. Keep in mind we went at 330pm. It was not busy at all! After we finish eating she kept walking by and just looking at the empty plates in front of us. Until I asked if she could take them away! Then we waited about 15 for our check. She brings it to us and just leaves and doesn't come back for another 10 mins. We didn't get outta there till 530pm.
This place is okay, went for the endless apps and it took forever even though it wasnt busy.

I went there for my birthday and it was a disaster. First of all , we had two servers that seemed to not be on the same page. One groups dinner was brought out before another ones. That wasn't a big deal in my opinion. The worst part was the way that we asked for utensils. They just brought out a bunch of first and knives and left them there. They were not wrapped or anything. We had to ask for napkins. When i asked the waitress if she could bring us wrapped utensils she said there were not enough people on site to do that . So my dad wrapped them. They could not even hand them out individually. They just left them there . We handed the utensils out ourselves. Some people's meat were not thoroughly cooked. Some people's food was not hot and someone even sent their meal back. The food was not great and service was horrible.
Some confusion over rewards coupon, but the manager did the right thing. Good ribs.  Not really crowded, got seated in about 10 minutes.  Went there as points were expiring

Stick to appetizers! I was there for lunch on a Saturday around 1pm. It was not busy at all, yet had to wait a long time for a salad, which was subpar. It did not look anything like the picture from the menu. While, I can't blame the waiter for that, I think he could've done better. He did not even bother to explain why salad was taking so long nor did he ask if he wanted all the food to come out at the same time as they often do at other restaurants; this considering the two other people at the table only ordered appetizers. Exceptional service should be the norm not an every now and then thing.
The manager Ann threatened an employee with her fist today. Is this a place you really want to eat? Is this where you want your kids to work?

Arrived at the restaurant Sunday around 1 PM, even tho the place was slow and not busy at all, we were told there would be a 15 minutes wait. No big deal, we stayed and waited to be seated. After a few minutes we were taken to our seat, where we sat for 15 minutes while the waitress just kept walking by ignoring us. Finally she came by and took our drink order, before we could tel her what we wanted for appetizer she just walked away. Came back another 15 -20 minutes later with our drinks and just placed them on the table and walked away, never asking if we wanted to order something. I had to call her and ask if she could take our order. Brought us appetizer with no plates. When the food came out, just slammed the plates in front of us and walked away, never asked if we needed anything else. WORST PLACE TO EAT IN WATERBURY CT WHEN IT COMES TO SERVICE!!! I SHOULD OF WENT TO CHILIS OR OLIVE GARDEN
Friendly staff , food is great , waiting time is acceptable, we had great time having dinner with my cousin and his family

We waited 10 minutes before we turned around and left. The place was not busy at all and no-one acknowledged us at all even though multiple people saw us. Same thing happened about a month ago, but we decided to give the place another try yesterday. Never again!

Out of all the TGIFridays I have been to this Waterbury CT location is horrendous.   I had a gift card so we went to use it.   The first time we were seated and ignored for 15 min then finally got water and placed our drink/ app selection.  30 min later no food or drinks so we walked out.   Went back a couple months later.  Sat down. No server came by for 10 min.  I didn't want to waste another 45 min and left ...... again.   It's a chain they should have some consistency

My BF and I go there for dinner tonight since neither of us had been in quite some time. His French onion soup was decent, my broccoli cheddar soup was actually really good. Then all the food went downhill from there. Ordered a burger which was really overcooked. The lettuce was wilting and the bun was stale. Plus the French fries were soggy. Sent it back. We also did the endless apps... chicken quesadillas were awful and again soggy. The new bacon nacho dish was the worst. Not even cheese! It was this weird white cream sauce with parmesan bits in it. Bacon was fake... and their homemade chips tasted like pure grease. It was gross. Only thing that was decent were the boneless buffalo chicken wings but they were semi cold. Overall the experience was awful. Would not recommend at all.

I called twice, then showed up with a friend for happy hour, and nobody knew about the $10 unlimited apps--though there was a happy hour menu for cheap (pretty limited--basically only chicken strips and quesadillas). A real disappointment, since all other TGI's in CT are doing it.  We were the only ones in the bar, which was a big airy open room filled with TVs. Good ambiance. The waiter was so cute and attentive (and not overly so). Chatted with us for a bit and was very quick to ask for reorders when our plates were emptying. Our silverware was clean and the food was good, hot, and fresh. Service is 10/10, but this TGI's could do with better management and more promotion. Otherwise it's a great undiscovered happy hour spot.

The food is beyond amazing but other things ruin the experience. They have a new to go appetizer menu.  You can't order it as an app though. Only to go.  We are eating in so why would we want an order to go.  Also the endless apps are now $15 instead of $10 and per person.  If you order one endless app and your table of 4 eat it, it will cost you $60. the endless app are now only for 1 person to eat and not the table.  The service is usually super slow but last night it was quick.  Maybe we will just order out from now on and enjoy the food at home.

I have been to TGI Fridays before but the minute I walked into this one I knew it was like no other. I was immediately hit with the smell of old wet towels. I waited at the hostess stand for a minute until I realized the hostess not only didn't acknowledge us she walked right past us without a simple glance. So we seated ourselves at the bar. We were greeted with Waterbury tap water which was disgusting. It took them 15 minutes to ask if we wanted anything other than water to drink. We then ordered the chicken nachos which came out in 23 seconds....clearly someone else's order. Then we ordered a simple bacon cheeseburger that didn't have a slice of bacon (literally no bacon) and took without exaggeration 35 minutes. I will never go back here and this specific restaurant single handedly changed my view on the entire chain. If I was corporate I would shut them Down for good. This was an absolute disaster.

Awful experience this evening. Bartender got my husband a drink and when i went to order, he walked away and proceeded to wait on other people including couple sitting next to us without asking me what I wanted ... finally asked other bartender for drink. We ordered 2 appys, waited 40 minutes, sliders were okay but boneless wings sat under lamp more than 15 minutes with the bleu cheese sauce in cup on plate. The bleu cheese was hot when I went to eat it. GROSS... My jack Daniels boneless wings were dry and bare when they arrived, I asked the bartender for jack daniels sauce and even though I waited 40 minutes for food, he let me wait while he made drinks. I went over and asked hostess to please send manager over and when he arrived, I was still waiting for sauce. Manager was nice and apologized  comped meals, which I didn't eat,  but bartender so rude it just ruined the meal.   Don't live in area anymore but won't ever go back when in town.  No reason not to be polite to customers.

Had the worst experience here. I went there for lunch at a time that it wasn't busy. The hostess was sitting down at a table as I entered. Then we were told that we have to wait for her to clean the table. Five minutes later we saw her and she was like oh I forgot I have to clean a table for you. We ate our food and got our bill. We explained we wanted to separate the charges. My fiancé's card and mine were both charged the full bill. The waitress must have realized her mistake after and properly charged his card. However she didn't let us know she made the mistake. Basically she hid It until he checked his account and we returned with questions and she told us what happened. If you make a mistake on someone's account you should let them know especially if their money will be on hold for days on end. Will not be going there again when mistakes are being made and it's not even a busy time of the  day.

Tonight we got there at 8:05 and didn't get our dinner until 9:20. My salmon was supposed to come with rice and they gave me mashed potatoes. I didn't complain because I just wanted to leave. Finally got the check at 9:40. It wasn't even crowded. Terrible all around.

Disgusting. This is a BBQ chicken salad, no BBQ sauce or dressing of any kind. 15 kernels of corn and 15 black beans. Yes I counted because I was pissed. No crispy onions. Very very disappointed. Ordered takeout. Never again.

Depressing, disgusting and disappointing! Lazy rude hostess/staff, filthy front area and nasty menus being wiped off by the hostess who dropped the rag on the floor in front of us and picked it up to continue wiping menus (ewww!!), weird loud rock music (not even the fun catchy top 40 type of rock) 1 week before Christmas is blasting out. No one wants to work so over 2/3 of the restaurant is completely empty and the staff that bothered to show reflect their hate for their jobs via hanging their heads and shuffling slowly to and fro. Hostess was so rude, not a single fiber of personality, and lazy AF. Done, never going back. Shame on this franchise for allowing this place to be taken over by zombies.

I would do 0 stars if it were an option, amazed place is in business. Walked in with my family, waited 10 minutes to be seated or atleast be approached by the hostess, place was empty no one came, got sick of waiting walked into bar slid into a booth w the family, proceeded to wait another 10 minutes as no one came over or acknowledged us, 2 bartenders were chest bumping and bsing, tvs were on infomercials no football games on a sunday at 1:45 in the afternoon, unbelievable. Staff was hardly dressed professionally, shirts unbuttoned, half tucked in, one waitress came to the bar and repeatedly petioned the bartender to give her a redbukk vodka, which to our surprise was declined. Didnt stick around to see how shitty the food was, staff was poor, management was poor, didnt need to see strike 3 to know it was coming. Will never go back to that dump would not be surprised if it doesnt make it in 2018- happy new year
